page.title: 05RELIGION C OF E
page.content: THE ANGLICAN CHURCH OF ST. NICHOLAS IN WEST TANFIELD HAS BEEN THERE SINCE THE 11th CENTURY.THE CHURCH TODAY IS MADE UP OF VERY OLD PARTS DATING BACK TO THE 1100's AND PARTS WHICH WERE RE-BUILT BY THE VICTORIANS.IN THE TOWER THERE ARE SIX BELLS WHICH ARE RUNG EACH SUNDAY.AROUND THE CHURCH IS A GRAVEYARD WITH ABOUT 200 GRAVES. FUNERALS ARE STILL CARRIED OUT IN THE GRAVEYARD,BUT MANY PEOPLE ARE TAKEN TO DARLINGTON OR HARROGATE FOR CREMATION. INSIDE THE CHURCH ARE MANY OLD GRAVES THE MOST FAMOUS ONE IS THE GRAVE OF THE MARMIONS,WHICH ATTRACTS PEOPLE FROM ALL OVER THE BRITISH ISLES.SERVICES ARE HELD IN THE CHURCH EACH SUNDAY AT DIFFERENT TIMES.THE AVERAGE CONGREGATION AT THE CHURCH IS 38.THE SERVICES HELD ARE COMMUNION,FAMILY SERVICE AND EVENSONG.REV.D.EYLES IS THE RECTOR.
